verses.kjv: The word which came unto Jeremiah from the LORD, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and all his army, and all the kingdoms of the earth of his dominion, and all the people, fought against Jerusalem, and against all the cities thereof, saying,
verses.ct: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD during the time when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, along with his entire army, all the kingdoms under his control, and all their forces, were attacking Jerusalem and all its surrounding towns.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel; Go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah, and tell him, Thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire:
verses.ct: The LORD, the God of Israel, said: "Go speak to Zedekiah king of Judah and tell him that the LORD says: 'I am going to hand this city over to the king of Babylon, and he will burn it to the ground.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt not escape out of his hand, but shalt surely be taken, and delivered into his hand; and thine eyes shall behold the eyes of the king of Babylon, and he shall speak with thee mouth to mouth, and thou shalt go to Babylon.
verses.ct: You will not escape from him. You will certainly be captured and handed over to him. You will stand face to face with the king of Babylon, and he will speak to you in person. Then you will be taken to Babylon.

verses.kjv: Yet hear the word of the LORD, O Zedekiah king of Judah; Thus saith the LORD of thee, Thou shalt not die by the sword:
verses.ct: But listen to the LORD's promise, Zedekiah king of Judah. This is what the LORD says about you: You will not die by the sword.

verses.kjv: But thou shalt die in peace: and with the burnings of thy fathers, the former kings which were before thee, so shall they burn odours for thee; and they will lament thee, saying, Ah lord! for I have pronounced the word, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: You will die peacefully. Just as people burned funeral spices for your ancestors, the kings who ruled before you, they will burn spices in your honor too. They will mourn for you, crying out, "Our lord is gone!" I have spoken this,' declares the LORD."

verses.kjv: Then Jeremiah the prophet spake all these words unto Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem,
verses.ct: Jeremiah the prophet delivered all of these words to Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: When the king of Babylon’s army fought against Jerusalem, and against all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish, and against Azekah: for these defenced cities remained of the cities of Judah.
verses.ct: This was while the Babylonian army was attacking Jerusalem and the remaining cities of Judah — specifically Lachish and Azekah, since these were the only fortified cities of Judah still standing.

verses.kjv: This is the word that came unto Jeremiah from the LORD, after that the king Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people which were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty unto them;
verses.ct: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem to announce their freedom —

verses.kjv: That every man should let his manservant, and every man his maidservant, being an Hebrew or an Hebrewess, go free; that none should serve himself of them, to wit, of a Jew his brother.
verses.ct: that everyone must release their male and female Hebrew servants, setting them free, so that no one would keep a fellow Jew in slavery.

verses.kjv: Now when all the princes, and all the people, which had entered into the covenant, heard that every one should let his manservant, and every one his maidservant, go free, that none should serve themselves of them any more, then they obeyed, and let them go.
verses.ct: All the officials and all the people who had agreed to this covenant heard that everyone was to release their male and female servants and no longer keep them enslaved. They complied and released them.

verses.kjv: But afterward they turned, and caused the servants and the handmaids, whom they had let go free, to return, and brought them into subjection for servants and for handmaids.
verses.ct: But later they changed their minds and forced the men and women they had freed to come back, making them slaves again.

verses.kjv: Therefore the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.ct: So the LORD gave this message to Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel; I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondmen, saying,
verses.ct: "The LORD, the God of Israel, says: I made a covenant with your ancestors on the day I brought them out of Egypt, out of the land where they were slaves. I told them,

verses.kjv: At the end of seven years let ye go every man his brother an Hebrew, which hath been sold unto thee; and when he hath served thee six years, thou shalt let him go free from thee: but your fathers hearkened not unto me, neither inclined their ear.
verses.ct: 'At the end of every 7 years, each of you must release any fellow Hebrew who has been sold to you. After they have served you for 6 years, you must set them free.' But your ancestors did not listen to me or pay any attention.

verses.kjv: And ye were now turned, and had done right in my sight, in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbour; and ye had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name:
verses.ct: Recently, you turned around and did what was right in my sight by announcing freedom for your neighbors. You made a covenant in my presence in the house that bears my name.

verses.kjv: But ye turned and polluted my name, and caused every man his servant, and every man his handmaid, whom he had set at liberty at their pleasure, to return, and brought them into subjection, to be unto you for servants and for handmaids.
verses.ct: But then you reversed course and dishonored my name. Each of you took back the male and female servants you had set free according to their wishes, and you forced them back into slavery.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Ye have not hearkened unto me, in proclaiming liberty, every one to his brother, and every man to his neighbour: behold, I proclaim a liberty for you, saith the LORD, to the sword, to the pestilence, and to the famine; and I will make you to be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.ct: So the LORD says: You have not listened to me by granting freedom to your fellow citizens and neighbors. Now pay attention — I am granting you a different kind of 'freedom,' declares the LORD: freedom to be destroyed by war, disease, and famine. I will make you an object of horror to every kingdom on earth.

verses.kjv: And I will give the men that have transgressed my covenant, which have not performed the words of the covenant which they had made before me, when they cut the calf in twain, and passed between the parts thereof,
verses.ct: The people who violated my covenant and did not keep the terms of the agreement they made in my presence — when they cut a calf in two and walked between its halves —

verses.kjv: The princes of Judah, and the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, and the priests, and all the people of the land, which passed between the parts of the calf;
verses.ct: the officials of Judah, the officials of Jerusalem, the court officers, the priests, and all the common people who walked between the pieces of the calf —

verses.kjv: I will even give them into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life: and their dead bodies shall be for meat unto the fowls of the heaven, and to the beasts of the earth.
verses.ct: I will hand all of them over to their enemies, to those who want them dead. Their corpses will become food for the birds of the heavens and the wild animals.

verses.kjv: And Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes will I give into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life, and into the hand of the king of Babylon’s army, which are gone up from you.
verses.ct: I will also hand Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials over to their enemies, to those who want them dead, and to the army of the king of Babylon — which has recently pulled back from you.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will command, saith the LORD, and cause them to return to this city; and they shall fight against it, and take it, and burn it with fire: and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation without an inhabitant.
verses.ct: Pay attention! I am going to give the order, declares the LORD, and bring them back to this city. They will attack it, capture it, and burn it down. I will turn the cities of Judah into an empty wasteland where no one lives."
